metadata.title: CVE-2017-11368 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: In MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) 1.7 and later, an authenticated attacker can cause a KDC assertion failure by sending invalid S4U2Self or S4U2Proxy requests. It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled certain S4U2Self or S4U2Proxy requests. A remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

criterions.comment: krb5 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.15.1-2').
